title: NITES opposes Karnataka's proposed IT work hours extension in letter to labour ministry
content: punebased industry body nascent information technology employees senate  nites  written labour ministry opposing proposed amendment extending working hours employees karnataka  nites also threatened nationwide strike turning computers amendment enacted  state government considering amending karnataka shops commercial establishments act  1961  proposes employees ititesbpo sector may required allowed work 12 hours day exceeding 125 hours three continuous months   vehemently oppose amendment wish vehemently express strongest dissent   nites wrote letter ministry  harpreet singh saluja  president nites  said employees bengaluru elsewhere already spend approximately 3 hours commuting day  extending work hours would detrimental effect employees  added   behalf employees across karnataka entire nation  urge government reconsider amendment seeks extend working hours beyond reasonable limits  july 20  karnataka state itites employees union  kitu  opposed proposal extend working hours employees ititesbpo sector  moneycontrol reported proposal increase working hours discussion table time  citing senior labour department official   demand ititesbpo sector extend timings  stakeholder meetings ongoing  nt decided yet   also read  totally inhumane   internet reacts karnataka firms  14hour workday proposal statement  kitu general secretary suhas adiga said   proposed karnataka shops commercial establishments  amendment  bill 2024  attempts normalise 14hour workday  existing act allows maximum 10 hours work per day  including overtime  completely lifted current amendment  enable itites companies extend daily hours work indefinitely
